title: Pin Your Component Versions
text:
Always pin component versions in your `ato.yaml` to ensure reproducible builds. Without pinning, a library update could silently change your BOM.

```yaml
dependencies:
  generics: "0.2.1"
  rp2040: "0.1.3"
```

title: Check Your Gerber Output
text: After generating Gerbers, always **visually inspect** them before sending to your fab house. Look for missing copper pours, incorrect drill sizes, and misaligned layers.

title: Use Assertions for Critical Values
text:
Use `assert` statements to enforce voltage and current limits at design time. The solver will catch violations before you ever send a board to manufacturing.

```ato
module PowerSupply:
  power = new Power
  assert power.voltage within 3.0V to 3.6V
  assert power.current within 0A to 500mA
```

title: JLCPCB Part Selection
text: Prefer JLCPCB **Basic** parts over **Extended** parts to avoid the $3 per-component loading fee. Basic parts are pre-loaded on their pick-and-place machines.

title: Keep Decoupling Caps Close
text: Place decoupling capacitors as close as possible to the power pins of ICs. The shorter the trace, the more effective the decoupling. Use the layout editor to verify placement.

title: Freeze Builds for Manufacturing
text:
Use the `--frozen` flag when building for manufacturing. This ensures no packages are auto-updated during the build, giving you a reproducible output.

```bash
ato build --frozen --target default
```

title: Review the BOM Before Ordering
text: Double-check your BOM for components marked as *no stock* or *lifecycle: obsolete*. Catching these early saves time and avoids costly board respins.

title: Set Board Dimensions Early
text: Define your board outline and mounting holes before routing. This prevents having to redo work when the mechanical constraints change late in the design.

title: Use Modules for Reusability
text:
Break your design into reusable modules. A well-tested power supply or sensor interface module can be shared across projects and reduces review time.

```ato
from "generics/resistors.ato" import Resistor

module VoltageDivider:
  r_top = new Resistor
  r_bottom = new Resistor
  signal top ~ r_top.p1
  r_top.p2 ~ r_bottom.p1 ~ signal output
  r_bottom.p2 ~ signal bottom
```

title: Check Thermal Relief on Ground Pads
text: Large ground planes can make hand-soldering difficult. Ensure **thermal relief spokes** are present on pads connected to ground planes, especially for through-hole components.
